intro: Psoralea brilliantissima, commonly known as the golden senna, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet having a distinctive waxy coating. Psoralea brilliantissima is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
